original_table_html:
OBJECTIVE 8-1 Define product and describe the major classifications of products and services.
What Is a Product? (pp 244–249)
OBJECTIVE 8-2 Describe the decisions companies make regarding their individual products and services, product lines, and product mixes.
Product and Service Decisions (pp 249–257)
OBJECTIVE 8-3 Identify the four characteristics that affect the marketing of services and the additional marketing considerations that services require.
Services Marketing (pp 258–264)
OBJECTIVE 8-4 Discuss branding strategy—the decisions companies make in building and managing their brands.
Branding Strategy: Building Strong Brands (pp 264–272)
summary_markdown: This content outlines key objectives related to product and service marketing, structured hierarchically. Objective 8-1 focuses on defining a product and categorizing major product and service classifications. Building upon this foundation, Objective 8-2 delves into the strategic decisions companies make concerning individual products, product lines, and their overall product mixes. Objective 8-3 then shifts focus to the unique aspects of marketing services, identifying four core characteristics that influence their promotion and highlighting additional marketing considerations specific to services. Finally, Objective 8-4 addresses branding strategy, detailing the decisions involved in building and managing strong brands. The objectives progress from fundamental definitions to strategic decision-making in product and service management and marketing.
